item.title: Random items
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:19, topic:384541”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=480305.msg3516238#msg3516238 date=1299020850]

ok so int random items goes into item.java?

If you like, but then you’ll have to give it the public and static modifiers:

public static int[] randomItems = { 0, 1, 2 // Replace with the item Id's that you want to be a random item. };

Then use the static access:

if (objectID == 357) { int randomItem = Iten.randomItems[new java.util.Random().nextInt(Item.randomItems.length)]; addItem(randomItem, 1); sM("You gain a random item!"); }

Or… You could just do,

if (objectID == 357) {
        addItem(Item.randomItems[(int) (Math.random() * randomItems.length)], 1);
        sM("You gain a random item!");
}

(If the math is right, l0l!)… But yea, that should work too.
[/quote]

The whole point of the Java library being there, is so we can use it. The Random class is there for the purpose of selecting random elements out of a set of values. It’s just more efficient and follows conventions more briefly, if you use what’s there to your advantage rather than making your own code that does the exact same job, whether or not the code is slightly more or less.[/quote]
I’d rather not create a new Random class object everytime a someone gets a random item. I’d just do the math, personally. I guess it’s totally up to the programmer what way they choose.

Read full topic

If you like, but then you’ll have to give it the public and static modifiers:

Then use the static access:

if (objectID == 357) { int randomItem = Iten.randomItems[new java.util.Random().nextInt(Item.randomItems.length)]; addItem(randomItem, 1); sM("You gain a random item!"); }
[/quote]
Or… You could just do,

if (objectID == 357) {
        addItem(Item.randomItems[(int) (Math.random() * randomItems.length)], 1);
        sM("You gain a random item!");
}

(If the math is right, l0l!)… But yea, that should work too.[/quote]

The whole point of the Java library being there, is so we can use it. The Random class is there for the purpose of selecting random elements out of a set of values. It’s just more efficient and follows conventions more briefly, if you use what’s there to your advantage rather than making your own code that does the exact same job, whether or not the code is slightly more or less.

item.title: Random items
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

x1 att ftw x:

Yes this is Delta And the guy b4 your post… i do realise that the question is * when u click the Object ( in this case The Crate ) it will give you a random item

Aha, to stop this thread from having 3943847367 million un-needed posts, I’ll just stop being lazy and post it.

Declare this:

Remember, you can always add more item id’s here or change the 1’s to something else;

Then declare this:

public static int randomItems() { return items[(int) (Math.random() * items.length)]; }

Now you said you wanted a ‘gambling’ system so I made it really basic, you can add more later on; Right now, you just pay 5m, then you get a random item from the array we declared.

if (objectID == 357 && playerHasItem(995, 5000000)) { addItem(randomItems(), 1); deleteItem(995, 5000000); sM("You pay 5m and take a random item!"); } else if(!playerHasItem(995, 5000000)) { sM("You need 5m to take a random item!"); }

I have now spoonfed you, congratulations.
If you actually couldn’t follow this I am not going to help you further, and you need to go read up on Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Random items
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Build an array with the items you want to be called at random. Since your server is a derivative of winterLove you could probably utilise a method in the Misc class that selects a random ID from an array. Have a look at how they are used. There was one last time I browsed the spaghetti of a derivative of winterLove.

Read full topic

[quote=“x1 att ftw x, post:3, topic:384541”]i got an error saying ilegal start of expresion… heres the pic

In itemid put what item you want (773 = perfect ring, for example)
In quantity put how many you want it to give (1 = one given)
